games.title: Survivor
games.rules:
-**Catching Rule**: If a player throws the ball and their ball is directly caught by another player, the thrower is out. Unsuccessful catch attempts result in the victim being out.
-**Double Possession Rule**: If you had possession of the ball and threw or dropped it, you cannot possess the ball again until at least 1 other player has had possession of the ball.
-**Out Rule**: If you are out, the highest you can raise yourself is upright on your knees.
-**Good Samaritan Rule**: If you throw the ball directly to someone who is out and they catch it, you are out; you must roll it to them.
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Direct Hit Rule**: Only direct hits are valid for getting players out, ricochets, rolls, and grounders are all invalid. But if the ball hits another player and then hits another before it touches the ground, both players are out.
-**Teaming Rule**: Teaming is strictly forbidden
-**Targeting Rule**: Targeting is strictly forbidden
howToPlay: Place the Ball in the middle and have every player start with their back to the wall. The referee counts down from 3, and on go, the game starts. The players must then fight for possession of the ball, whoever has the ball is allowed to take up to 3 steps and then must throw the ball after at most 3 seconds of standing still.
If a player is hit directly with the ball (shots above the shoulders are invalid), then that player is out, they then must sit down wherever they got hit.

If a player is out, they must try and obtain possession of the ball without moving or getting up. In order to get back in, they must hit a player who is currently in without moving. If they do, they are back in and the other player is out.
Once the game reaches 3 players, all players are allowed up to 5 steps
Once it is 1 verse 1, then it is up to 7 steps. The last player standing is the winner.

games.title: Block Tournament
games.rules:
-**Catching Rule**: If a player throws the ball and their ball is directly caught by another player, the thrower loses one point in the current match. Unsuccessful catch attempts result in the victim giving the opponent another hit.
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Direct Hit Rule**: Only direct hits are valid for getting players out, ricochets, rolls, and grounders are all invalid. But if the ball hits another player and then hits another before it touches the ground, both players are out.
games.setup: Arena (array of stacked and lined up chairs in the center)
howToPlay: Enter every player‚Äôs name into the tournament bracket and set up the arena (if player count is small, create a loser‚Äôs bracket).
Place 3 blocks on either side for the contestants to start with.
The referee counts the game down: 3, 2, 1, Go.

The game then begins, the players can move all around the arena and their only mission objective is to eliminate the other player by hitting them directly 3 times (Shots above the shoulders are invalid).
Whoever wins the round advances in the tournament.
Whoever wins the final wins the tournament!
At the start of every round there is a 1:30 minute timer, after that timer expires the match enters Sudden Death: next hit wins regardless of how many hits that player had before.
games.safetyNotes: DO NOT PARKOUR OVER THE FURNITURE

games.title: Team Handball
games.rules:
**Crease Rules**
-The crease is marked by caution tape on the floor
-No player except the goalie may step into the crease
-Any goal scored while a non-goalie player is inside the crease does NOT count
-The goalie must stay inside the crease during play
**Goalie Rules**
-Goalies are the only players allowed inside the crease
-Goalies cannot leave the crease area
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
games.setup: Open Space, 2 Goals, Creases for each goal
howToPlay: To score, players must shoot the ball from outside the crease
Players move the ball using their hands (no feet like soccer)
A player holding the ball can take:
Up to 3 steps (NOT leaps or jumps to travel distance)
3 seconds to pass or shoot after coming to a full stop
The team with the most goals in the allotted time wins
Ref/teacher can be asked questions during game time
The goalie may tag out with another player in-between goals.

games.title: Musical Chairs Of Doom
games.rules:
-**Parkour Rule**: You are not allowed to parkour over the furniture (sliding under tables is allowed).
-**Hands Off Rule**: No touching the chairs or hovering your hand over them while the song is playing.
games.setup: Musical Chairs Setup (2 Chairs Are Missing). [OPTIONAL] Create an arena to the side for the duels.
howToPlay: Musical Chairs Setup
Two fewer chairs than there are players
Music plays while everyone walks around the chairs
When the music stops, everyone rushes to sit
The 2 players who fail to get a seat enter The Pit
Each player gets 3 foam blocks at opposite ends of The Pit
Dodgeball Duel
A quick 1 vs. 1 dodgeball match using the foam blocks
First player to get hit is eliminated
One chair is removed from the lineup
Game resets with remaining players
Final Battle
When only 2 players remain, they face off in The Pit
games.safetyNotes: If you're sitting in the chairs, I recommend ducking your head

games.title: Haunted House
games.rules:
-**Parkour Rule**: You are not allowed to parkour over the furniture (sliding under tables is allowed).
-**‚ÄúHold-On‚Äù Rule**: Ghosts cannot throw their ball, they must hold onto it at all times with both hands.
games.setup: Open Space (Setup an arena), array of chairs stacked and lined up, tables for extra space coverage, one set upright to slide under
howToPlay: Players are divided into:
Ghosts
Ghosts try to tag all survivors
Tagged survivors cannot move until revived
Survivors
Survivors move around the arena, trying to avoid being tagged
If tagged, a survivor must:
Sit down
Raise their hand to signal they are ‚Äúdown‚Äù
Survivors still in the game can revive a tagged teammate by touching their raised hand
Ghosts win if they tag all survivors at the same time
Survivors win if they survive until the clock runs out without full elimination
games.safetyNotes: DO NOT PARKOUR OVER THE FURNITURE

games.title: 1 Arm 1 Leg
games.rules:
-**Neighbors Rule**: You cannot pass to the person next to you unless there are 5 or less people left.
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Targeting Rule**: Targeting is strictly forbidden.
-**Teaming Rule**: Teaming is strictly forbidden.
howToPlay: Players all form a circle, and then simply play a game of catch.
If a player throws a poor pass (pass falls short is not accurate to their target) or fails to catch a ball, they must then lose either 1 arm, or 1 leg.
2 penalties will leave the player playing with only 1 arm and 1 leg
3 results in them being eliminated.
The last player standing wins!

games.title: A Quiet Place
games.rules:
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Targeting Rule**: Targeting is strictly forbidden.
-**Catching Rule**: If a player throws the ball and their ball is directly caught by another player, the thrower is out. Unsuccessful catch attempts result in the victim being out.
-**Direct Hit Rule**: Only direct hits are valid for getting players out, ricochets, rolls, and grounders are all invalid. But if the ball hits another player and then hits another before it touches the ground, both players are out.
-**See No Evil Rule**: The player on the offense cannot peak or see through the blindfold at all.
howToPlay: One player is selected to be blindfolded and given the weapon of choice
That player must then stand in the center (or wander if they have a melee weapon) and use their weapon to eliminate player
They must listen out for noises in order to find out where other players are
Everybody else must try and evade the player on the offense
If you‚Äôre tagged you are eliminated
The players on defense must try to run down the clock
The player on the offense must try and eliminate everyone before the timer expires
The target goal can be subject to change.
games.safetyNotes: Be mindful of the people around you

games.title: Hunting Season
games.rules:
-**Direct Hit Rule**: Only direct hits are valid for getting players out, ricochets, rolls, and grounders are all invalid. But if the ball hits another player and then hits another before it touches the ground, both players are out.
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Catching Rule**: If a player throws the ball and their ball is directly caught by another player, the thrower is out. Unsuccessful catch attempts result in the victim being out.
howToPlay: Hunters try to eliminate all the game
Game try to survive until time runs out
1‚Äì2 players are chosen as Hunters
All other players are Game
Hunters stand inside a designated box
Game players move along the borders of the arena
Game players must stay outside the hunter box
If a game player is hit, they are:
Out (Required to sit on the sideline)
Game players who are still in may attempt to catch a throw from the hunter
If a game player successfully catches a throw from the hunter:
The game player who has been sitting out the longest returns to play
Game wins if they successfully run out the clock
Hunters win if they eliminate all game players before time expires

games.title: Iron Guard
materials: 2 foam blocks not of the same color
games.rules:
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Parkour Rule**: You are not allowed to parkour over the furniture (sliding under tables is allowed).
**‚ÄúHold-On‚Äù Rule**: Chosen Protectors cannot throw their ball, they must hold onto it at all times with both hands.
-**Chivalry Rule**: Knights cannot swing at other knights ‚Äî all shots will be null and void. If a knight is caught violating their chivalrous code (breaking knight-only rules), they must remain still for 10 seconds and cannot swing at any players.
-**Targeting Rule**: Targeting is strictly forbidden.
-**Traitor Rule**: You cannot conspire with members of the opposing team.
games.setup: Open Space (Setup an arena), array of chairs stacked and lined up, tables for extra space coverage, one set upright to slide under
howToPlay: How To Play (Iron Guard)
2 teams compete against each other
Each team has:
1 Knight (the ‚ÄúIron Guard‚Äù)
Everyone else = Game Players
Each team secretly chooses 1 Royal Chancellor (a normal player)
Each team captain will report their royal chancellor secretly to the referee(s).
Goal: Protect your Royal Chancellor while trying to eliminate the other team‚Äôs Royal Chancellor
The Knight uses a pool noodle ‚Äúsword‚Äù to defend teammates and tag opponents
Rules (Iron Guard)
Knights can ONLY walk
No running, sprinting, or speed-walking
Knights carry a block
The Knight can hand (or toss) the block to ONE teammate
That teammate becomes the Knight‚Äôs chosen protector

TURNOVER RULE: If the Knight tosses the block to another player and the throw is intercepted by a member of the opposing team, that player can then tag the Knight that threw the block. The block is returned to the Knight and the Knight must remain still for 10 seconds ‚Äî the Knight cannot swing at anyone either during those 10 seconds.
Chosen Protector Rule:
The protector may run up and tag ONE opponent (the knight‚Äôs choice)
The Knight MUST then loudly shout the target‚Äôs name so everyone is made aware of the target
After tagging, the tagged opponent must freeze for 5 seconds
The protector must return the block to the Knight immediately
The block can‚Äôt be used again until it is back with the Knight, and after the knight slays at least one more person
If you are slain (tagged out), you must:
Go sit out on the altar for 15 seconds
Then you may return to the game
Royal Chancellor Rule:
If the Royal Chancellor is slain 3 times, their team loses
The other team is crowned the winner
No one is allowed to reveal who their Royal Chancellor is (keep it secret)
Any questions may be asked before the game begins
games.safetyNotes: DO NOT PARKOUR OVER THE FURNITURE
games.leaderTips: Referees must be as fair as possible and enforce penalties effectively

games.title: Hot Potato
games.rules:
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Targeting Rule**: Targeting is strictly forbidden.
howToPlay: Every player participating will stand in a circle around the arena
From there a game of game of catch will take place where the ball simply get passed from person-to-person
You cannot pass to the person next to you until there are 5 or less people left in the game
A random timer is playing in the background
If the timer expires and you are the one holding the ball, you are eliminated
Whoever is the last one standing is crowned the winner.
Any questions may be asked
If no one is holding the ball when the timer expires due to a bad pass, the thrower is eliminated.

games.title: Buzzed Out
games.rules:
-**Shortcuts Rule**: You cannot use any terms in the actual words to describe them (Ex: You cannot say "It mows the lawn" to describe a lawn mower, but you could say "it cuts the grass.").
-**Verbal Rule**: You can only explain terms verbally, no using physical gestures.
howToPlay: Create 2 teams.

Have the team captains flip a coin to decide who start with the card. The starting team will decide the first guesser, then survey the card and pick a term to begin with. The game begins when the timer starts. Which ever team is holding the card when the timer expires is the loser. Whoever scores the most points in the set amount of rounds wins. Hold onto the card for each victory to tally score.
games.leaderTips: Penalties result in the correct guess of a word not transferring card possession to the other team.

games.title: Video Games
games.rules: Treat all of the equipment with care and respect
games.setup: Hook up any game consoles being used
howToPlay: Outings such as Video Games won't receive explanations (simply do what the game says)

games.title: Bowling
howToPlay: Out-of-house outings such as Bowling won't receive explanations

games.title: Roller/Ice Skating
howToPlay: Out-of-house outings such as Skating won't receive explanations

games.title: Indoor Trampoline Park
howToPlay: Out-of-house outings such as Indoor Trampoline Park won't receive explanations

games.title: Flag Football
games.rules:
-**Diplomacy Rule**: No physical violence is allowed at any time. This includes wrestling for the ball, tug of war for the ball, tackling, hitting, and any things of that nature.
-**Traitor Rule**: You cannot conspire with members of the opposing team.
-**Complete Catch Rule**: a completed pass requires a player to secure firm control of the ball in bounds, touch the ground with at least one foot (or any body part other than the hand), and maintain control long enough to make a football move (e.g., advance, avoid a defender). If falling, the player must maintain control upon contact with the ground
games.setup: 1 Football, Flag Football Belts, 2 Teams (Each either with 1 Quarterback or Assign 1 All-Time QB)
howToPlay: Score more touchdowns than the other team by moving the ball down the field and crossing into the end zone.
Offense Rules
The offense tries to run or pass the ball down the field
The quarterback has 7 seconds to throw the ball before being ‚Äúsacked‚Äù
If a player‚Äôs flag is pulled:
The play ends at that spot
Only one forward pass allowed per play
Must get a first down by reaching the next cone/marker
Defense Rules
The defense stops plays by pulling the ball-carrier‚Äôs flag
No holding, tripping, or physical contact
Interceptions can be returned for extra yards or a touchdown
Scoring
Touchdown = 6 points
After scoring, team attempts a 1-point play from short distance
Game restarts with a throw-off to the other team
Team with the most points when time expires wins
games.safetyNotes:
Safety and Conduct Rules
No tackling, stiff-arming, or diving for flags
Keep hands away from the neck/head area
Play with control and good sportsmanship
games.leaderTips: See if permission to use the field at the sports complex on Furrows Rd. is allowed

games.title: Laser Tag
howToPlay: Out-of-house outings such as Laser Tag won't receive explanations
